content: हार्य {%<ab>a.</ab>%} {@--1@} To be taken or comveyed. {@--2@} To be borne or carried on; यदूढया वारणराजहार्यया <ls>Ku. 5. 70.</ls> {@--3@} To be taken away or snatched off; <ls>R. 7. 67.</ls> {@--4@} To be displaced or borne away (as by wind); <ls>R. 16. 43.</ls> {@--5@} To be shaken (as one's resolution); <ls>Ku. 5. 8.</ls> {@--6@} To be secured or won over, to be attracted, conquered or influenced; वहसि हि धनहार्यं पण्यभूतं शरीरं <ls>Mk. 1. 31</ls>; <ls>Ku. 5. 53</ls>; <ls>Ms. 7. 217.</ls> {@--7@} To be seized or robbed; <ls>Ms. 8. 417.</ls> --र्यः {@--1@} A snake. {@--2@} The tree called Bibhītaka. {@--3@} The dividend (in math.).
